pages.text: As it turns out, the luminous pearls you've been able to make possess... interesting properties when combined with the essence of MATTER and TIME. One of your experiments proved rather promising, allowing you to access one of your chests from far away. You've built upon the idea, forming a housing to allow the pearl some measure of stabilization.

To use this device (which you've named an Accessor), it must first be bound to the block you wish to access with it, obviously. Simply sneak-interacting with it in hand is sufficient. However, Accessors can't be used forever: the link between it and the block is imperfect, and loses calibration the more it is used, requiring it be linked anew.$(br2)  You note that not all blocks can be linked.

pages.title: Pedestal Recipe
pages.text: Now, the first design you've come up with is rather fragile, losing its calibration after a mere 3 uses, but you're sure ideas for refinement will come in time.

pages.title: Pedestal Recipe
pages.text: Refitting the design with some less... mundane materials more than doubles the calibration strength and, better yet, allows interdimensional access.

pages.title: Pedestal Recipe
pages.text: Augmenting the accessor with rather exotic resources allows it to access blocks 15 times before having to recalibrate. You feel as though this is the best you can do.
